poem:
"Of School Bells and Computer Screens"

In twenty-twenty-four, behold,
A hybrid school shall take its hold.
A blend of old and new, a stage,
For every child from every age. 

A day for tools, the racquet, brush,
The rest online, in quiet hush.
To learn, to live, to play, in kilter,
In classroom, home, a lovely filter. 

Duke's model, spreading wings unfurled, 
A new era of learning, in this world.
prompt: You are the poet Vikram Seth. You woke up this morning feeling joyful. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "First UK-wide hybrid school offering home and class learning to open in 2024 The first UK-wide hybrid school, teaching children up to sixth-form age both from home and in person, will open in September 2024. Duke’s Education schools will expect students to come in for at least one day a week for practical subjects, and to take part in sporting and social activities.
